means: 自负的事物，引以为傲的东西
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 博斯特绰号，爱吹牛者，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“吹牛，自负”(bragging,vainglory)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"自夸，吹嘘"之意。
means: boast ： 普通用词，指对自己所做的事，自己的长处、财富以及家庭等的夸耀，常含言过其实的意味。
brag ： 非正式用词，其夸耀和吹嘘意味强于boast，到了过分夸大，有时令人讨厌的地步。
crow ： 多指大声吵嚷地吹嘘，夸耀自己做某事比他人做得好。
pride ： 与boast的意义较接近，指炫耀、夸口，自鸣得意，常与反身代词连用。

sentence.Network_en: We remember our mother's stern instructions not to boast.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们谨记母亲不许我们在人前炫耀的严厉教诲。

sentence.Network_en: This year's festival can boast a decently long list of sponsors.
sentence.Network_cn: 今年该活动节将会拥有相当多的赞助商。

sentence.Network_en: His statement isn't merely an idle boast.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的话不仅仅是虚张声势的自夸。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (as a noun): of unknown origin
late 19th cent.: perhaps from French bosse denoting a rounded projection in the wall of a court for real tennis

entry.def: If someone boasts about something that they have done or that they own, they talk about it very proudly, in a way that other people may find irritating or offensive.

example.ex: Witnesses said Furci boasted that he took part in killing them...
example.tran: 几位证人声称富尔奇曾吹嘘自己参与了对他们的屠杀。
卡萝尔炫耀着自己的穿着打扮。

entry.tran: 有，拥有（值得骄傲的成就或财产）
entry.def: If someone or something can boast a particular achievement or possession, they have achieved or possess that thing.

example.ex: The houses will boast the latest energy-saving technology...
example.tran: 这些房屋将应用最新的节能技术。

example.ex: Frommen says his country boasts a healthy economy.
example.tran: 弗罗曼称他的国家经济运行良好。

means.word_mean: 2. wear or display in an ostentatious or proud manner;

auth_sentence.content: They soon found such a boast was vain indeed.
auth_sentence.res_content: They soon found such a boast was vain indeed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They soon found such a boast was vain indeed.

auth_sentence.content: The companies boast strong cash flows and stable businesses.
auth_sentence.res_content: The companies boast strong cash flows and stable businesses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The companies boast strong cash flows and stable businesses.

auth_sentence.content: Denyse Beaulieu can't boast of the same birthright.
auth_sentence.res_content: Denyse Beaulieu can't boast of the same birthright.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Denyse Beaulieu can't boast of the same birthright.

Sentence.sentence: And most noticeable of all, there is the phenomenon of large urban and suburban high schools that have split up into smaller units of a few hundred, generally housed in the same grounds that once boasted thousands of students all marching to the same band.
For a start, you will now see plenty more women – the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School, for example, boasts that 40% of its new enrolment is female.

jushi.english: Don't believe him; he's just boasting.
jushi.chinese: 别信他,他不过是在吹牛。
